intro: Nidorella podocephala, commonly known as the broad-leaved helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive spurred lip. Native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan, it thrives in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky slopes. The plant has a rhizomatous root system and is known for its ability to tolerate low light conditions. Its botanical features make it a unique and interesting subject for study in both horticulture and ecological research.
